author: sky.cactus
content:
> And I guess in terms of sending the transaction, you don't need to re-sign it? Just like how in MetaMask you can "speed up" your transaction?
No need to resign.  This is unlike MetaMask speed up which actually does resign.  All transactions can be included without any wallet/app upgrade, they just will overpay on gas.

author: sky.cactus
content: <@489256758989029405> if we remove the transition period we actually need less buy-in from wallets because we will be able to include legacy transactions indefinitely.  Deprecating the legacy transaction format will be a separate process that can be achieved via a legacy tax or something but would be out of scope for 1559.

author: abdel.stark
content: <@!301186049323958275> if we remove the transition period the target gas used becomes the gas limit from the header of the parent always ?

author: sky.cactus
content: I think the spec may re-order things a bit though, I forget.

content: We restarted the network with the latest base fee computation

author: tkstanczak
content: incorrect block construction - EIP1559 gas limit exceeded

author: sky.cactus
content: <@489256758989029405> what is the miner voted value in the block header?

author: sky.cactus
content: 10,003,262?  If so, that means the upper limit is over 20M gas (2x the miner voted value).

author: sky.cactus
content: The miner voted value (formerly named block gas limit) is now colloquially named gas_target, and the "limit" is 2x the target.
